item.title: 特朗普威胁从 6 月起对欧盟商品征收 50% 关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁从 6 月 1 日起对来自欧盟的商品征收 50%的关税，并称 "我们与他们的讨论毫无进展"。【原文：President Donald Trump threatened a 50% tariff on goods from the European Union starting on June 1, saying “our discussions with them are going nowhere.”】

item.title: 中国需求依然强劲，令大型天然气公司欢欣鼓舞
item.description:
今年的进口量有所下降，但有迹象表明，随着该国逐渐适应摇摆市场，情况正在好转。【原文：

Imports have fallen this year, but there are signs of improvement as the country adjusts to being a swing market.

】

item.title: 印度央行创纪录地支付 316 亿美元，为政府财政提供支持
item.description: 印度央行将向政府发放创纪录的红利，以加强财政支持，促进亚洲第三大经济体的增长。【原文：India’s central bank will give a record dividend to the government, shoring up finances to bolster growth in Asia’s third largest economy.】

item.title: 欧盟同意恢复乌克兰贸易配额，战争仍在继续
item.description: 欧盟已同意恢复对从乌克兰进口的几种农产品的配额，这给乌克兰饱受战争创伤的经济带来了更大的挑战。【原文：The European Union has agreed to reinstate quotas on imports of several agricultural goods from Ukraine, adding to the challenges faced by its war-hit economy.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁：如果 iPhone 不是美国制造，将对苹果公司征收 25% 的关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁说，如果苹果公司不在美国生产 iPhone，将对其征收至少 25% 的关税。【原文：President Donald Trump threatened Apple Inc. with a tariff of at least 25% if the tech company does not manufacture their iPhones in the US.】

item.title: 科技公司成功上市潮给硅谷初创企业带来希望
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是我们的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，凯蒂-鲁夫（Katie Roof）和凯特-克拉克（Kate Clark）将报道硅谷科技初创公司最近在公开市场成功上市后的曙光。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Katie Roof and Kate Clark report on the light at the end of the tunnel for Silicon Valley tech startups after a few recent successful debuts in the public markets.】

item.title: 特朗普批评英国征收北海税阻碍钻井活动
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普批评了英国对北海石油和天然气征税的做法，称这种做法阻碍了钻探，提高了能源价格。【原文：US President Donald Trump criticized the UK’s approach to taxing North Sea oil and gas, saying it discouraged drilling and raised energy prices.】

item.title: 病态动物提醒世界粮食贸易的脆弱性
item.description: 蔫头耷脑的鸡或肉里钻出蛆虫的牛，这些都是扰乱全球贸易的疾病造成的影响。【原文：Lethargic chickens with swollen heads or cattle with maggots burrowing into their flesh — these are effects of diseases that have been disrupting global trade.】

item.title: 恢复美国工厂就业所需的 3 万亿美元资金
item.description: 我是马克-尼奎特，驻俄亥俄州哥伦布市的美国经济记者。今天我们关注的是美国制造业就业回流的问题。请将反馈意见和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册接收本新闻通讯，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Mark Niquette, a US economy reporter in Columbus, Ohio. Today we’re looking at bringing back manufacturing jobs to the US. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 老虎基金支持的 Robinhood 竞争对手推出别具一格的 DIY 指数编制服务
item.description: 如果您想建立一个指数，投注于前往火星的公司、拥有最多社交媒体追随者的公司，或者那些首席执行官身高超过六英尺的公司，您会怎么做？【原文：What if you wanted to build an index betting on companies traveling to Mars, firms with the most social-media followers, or those with CEOs over six feet tall?】

item.title: 西班牙推出帮助 IPO 避免市场动荡的方案
item.description: 西班牙股市为混乱时期的首次公开募股找到了一个创造性的解决方案：先在交易所注册，然后在时机成熟时迅速出售股票。【原文：Spain’s stock market has found a creative solution for initial public offerings in chaotic times: register on the exchange first and then quickly sell shares when the time is right.】

item.title: 债券市场成为特朗普贸易战的焦点
item.description:
贸易新闻未能像 4 月份那样推动股市上涨

。【原文：

Trade news is failing to move stocks like it did in April

】

item.title: 美国长期借贷成本因赤字担忧而飙升
item.description: 随着全球市场对世界最大经济体不断扩大的财政赤字日益焦虑，债券投资者对持有长期美债的补偿要求越来越高。【原文：Bond investors are demanding more and more compensation to hold long-dated US debt as global markets grow anxious about the widening fiscal deficit in the world’s biggest economy.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚计划今年首次发行点心和袋鼠债券
item.description: 印度尼西亚政府正计划首次出售以人民币和澳元计价的债券，以实现债务组合的多样化。【原文：Indonesia is planning to sell bonds denominated in the Chinese yuan and Australian dollar for the first time ever, as the government seeks to diversify its debt portfolio.】

item.title: 价值 2 万美元的中国 "家庭伴侣 "机器人将于今年亮相
item.description: 中国的优必选机器人公司（UBTech Robotics Corp.【原文：China’s UBTech Robotics Corp. is planning to unveil a $20,000 humanoid robot that can serve as a household companion this year, seeking to expand beyond factories.】

item.title: 中国批准 PAG 出资 69 亿美元收购万达购物中心的计划
item.description: 中国反垄断监管机构已批准由 PAG 主导的对大连万达商业管理集团股份有限公司旗下 48 家购物中心的收购。【原文：China’s antitrust regulator has approved a PAG-led acquisition of 48 shopping malls under Dalian Wanda Commercial Management Group Co.】

item.title: 在特朗普的最新反击中，欧洲人计划减少暑期赴美次数
item.description: 随着夏季旅游旺季的临近，欧洲人计划赴美旅游的人数减少了10%，这是一个最新迹象，表明随着对唐纳德-特朗普总统政策的反感情绪日益高涨，一些国际游客正在回避美国。【原文：Europeans are planning 10% fewer trips to the US as the busy summer season approaches, in the latest sign that some international travelers are avoiding America as backlash grows against President Donald Trump’s policies.】

item.title: 交易员赌 100 亿美元雪佛龙-赫斯交易胜过埃克森案例
item.description: 未来几天，兼并套利基金今年最大的赌注将面临关键考验，因为一个私人仲裁小组将开始审理埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp.【原文：Merger-arbitrage funds’ biggest wager of the year faces a crucial test in the coming days, as a private arbitration panel begins hearing Exxon Mobil Corp.’s challenge to Chevron Corp.’s $53 billion takeover of Hess Corp.】

item.title: 日本天然气油轮巨头认为难以购买中国船只
item.description: 全球最大的液化天然气运输船船队所有者三井物产轮船公司表示，由于美国加强了对亚洲国家造船业的审查，目前很难购买中国船只。【原文：Mitsui O.S.K. Lines, owner of the world’s largest fleet of liquefied natural gas carriers, said it is hard to buy Chinese vessels for the time being as the US ramps up scrutiny of the Asian country’s shipbuilding industry.】

item.title: 保加利亚有望获得欧盟批准明年加入欧元区
item.description: 保加利亚即将扫清采用欧元的一大障碍，使这个黑海国家有望在明年加入欧元区。【原文：Bulgaria is close to clearing a major hurdle toward euro adoption, putting the Black Sea nation on course to join the currency area next year.】

item.title: 台湾人寿负责人因外汇问题失眠，计划实施储备金新规
item.description: 台币对美元汇率最近的飙升至少让台北的一家大型保险公司寝食难安。【原文：The Taiwan dollar’s recent surge against the greenback is causing sleepless nights for at least one major insurer in Taipei.】

item.title: 力拓希望新老板打造面向未来的矿业公司
item.description: 当雅各布-斯陶霍尔姆（Jakob Stausholm）就任力拓集团（Rio Tinto Group）一把手时，他的任务是修复这家公司的声誉，因为这家公司刚刚爆破了一处有 46000 年历史的原住民圣地，并且在应对措施上出现了失误。现在，这家全球第二大矿业公司决定需要一位能够带领公司走向未来的老板。【原文：When Jakob Stausholm took the top job at Rio Tinto Group, his task was to repair the reputation of a company that had just blasted through a 46,000-year-old sacred Aboriginal site and bungled its response. Now the world’s second-largest miner has decided it needs a boss that can lead it into the future.】

item.title: 美银美林哈特内特称收益率突破 5%时买入跌势中的国债
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的迈克尔-哈特内特（Michael Hartnett）认为，投资者应该买入长期国债的抛售，因为政府可能会听从债券警戒者的警告，控制其债务。【原文：Investors should buy the selloff in long-dated Treasuries as the government is likely to heed warnings from bond vigilantes to bring its debt under control, according to Bank of America Corp.’s Michael Hartnett.】

item.title: OnlyFans 所有者探索以 80 亿美元估值出售该公司
item.description: 据一位熟知内情的人士透露，OnlyFans Ltd. 的所有者 Leonid Radvinsky 正在探讨出售这家成人内容社交网络的事宜，其估值约为 80 亿美元。【原文：OnlyFans Ltd. owner Leonid Radvinsky is exploring a sale of the adult-content social network that would value it at about $8 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 四月狂飙之后，股市无视特朗普的贸易战
item.description: 股票投资者开始淡忘唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战。【原文：Stock investors are starting to tune out President Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 越南因非法内容采取措施封杀 Telegram 应用程序
item.description: 越南当局已指示当地电信和互联网服务提供商在该国封杀 Telegram 消息应用程序，因为据称该应用程序未能阻止其用户进行非法内容和反政府活动。【原文：Vietnam authorities have instructed local telecoms and internet service providers to block the Telegram messaging app in the country, for allegedly failing to prevent illegal content and anti-government activities being carried out by its users.】

item.title: 中国机器人热潮来袭，EngineAI 目标估值 10 亿美元
item.description: EngineAI 的目标是在今年晚些时候以 10 亿美元的估值进行一轮融资，寻求资金加入开发仿人机器人的全球竞赛。【原文：EngineAI is targeting a round of financing later this year at a $1 billion valuation, seeking capital to join a global race to develop humanoid robots.】

item.title: 日本债券收益率周五尾盘下跌，削减近期涨幅
item.description: 在经历了一周的快速上涨之后，日本 30 年期和 40 年期国债收益率在周五尾盘下跌了 10 多个基点。【原文：After a week of rapid increases, yields on Japan’s 30- and 40-year government bonds dropped more than 10 basis points in late trading on Friday.】

item.title: 赞比亚停止加息，原因是玉米种植热潮导致通胀降温
item.description: 赞比亚中央银行维持关键利率不变，因为它预计通货紧缩进程将继续下去。【原文：Zambia’s central bank held its key interest rate as it expects the disinflation process to continue.】

item.title: 欧元区工资增长下滑，支持欧洲央行进一步宽松
item.description: 衡量欧元区薪资增长的一项关键指标大幅下滑，支持了欧洲中央银行关于通胀将很快达到2%目标的说法，也支持了进一步降低利率的呼吁。【原文：A key measure of euro-area pay growth plunged, supporting the European Central Bank’s claim that inflation will soon hit the 2% target and backing calls to lower interest rates further.】
